Alcohol. 
     504. The tables of our American people are generally prepared in a manner to make drunkards. . . . 
                                                                           112
By the use of tea and coffee an appetite is formed for tobacco, and this encourages the appetite for liquors. . . . Youth in general are governed by impulse and are slaves to appetite. In the glutton, the tobacco devotee, the wine-bibber, and the inebriate, we see the evil results of defective education.--T., V. III, p. 563.
